page.title: 05THE VIADUCT OR FLYOVER II
page.content: STITCH AND WAS MADE IN PLACE BY POURING CEMENT INTO A MOULD.THE BOX GIRDERS ARE HOLLOW AND HAVE ZIG-ZAG EDGES CALLED SHEAR KEYS WHICH WERE COATED WITH AN EPOXY RESIN GLUE AND FITTED INTO PLACE BY MEANS OF ENORMOUS JACKS.THE SPANS ARE MADE STABLE BY CABLES INSIDE THE CONCRETE OF THE BOX GIRDERS.THE WIDTH ACROSS THE ROAD IS 7 METRES,AT THE TOP,5 METRES AT THE BASE,WITH A DEPTH OF 2.9 METRES. THE TOTAL VOID WIDTH IS 11 METRES.EACH BOX WEIGHS BETWEEN 44 & 52TONS.THE VIADUCT IS A CURVING S SHAPE AND VERY PLEASING TO LOOK AT.TO REALLY ENJOY THE VIEWS WHEN DRIVING OVER IT YOU NEED TO BE HIGH UP,SO YOU CAN LOOK OVER THE SIDE .THE ROAD IS ONLY SINGLE CARRIAGE WAY AT THE MOMENT BUT SO IT CAN BECOME DUAL CARRIAGE WAY IN THE FUTURE,SPACE HAS BEEN LEFT AT EACH END.THE BUILDERS WERE SHEPHERD HILL LIMITED.
